criteria: Accuracy in Identifying Location and Describing the Rise of the Roman Republic
Understanding the Importance of Mythical and Historical Figures
Depth of Knowledge and Historical Context
descriptions: The student fails to identify the location of the Roman Republic and provides no description of its rise.
The student identifies the location of the Roman Republic with significant inaccuracies and provides a very limited or flawed description of its rise.
The student identifies the location of the Roman Republic with some inaccuracies and provides a basic description of its rise with significant omissions or misunderstandings.
The student accurately identifies the location of the Roman Republic and provides a satisfactory description of its rise, but lacks depth and detail.
The student accurately identifies the location of the Roman Republic and provides a detailed and clear description of its rise, demonstrating a good understanding of the key events and factors.

The student accurately identifies the location of the Roman Republic and provides a comprehensive and insightful description of its rise, demonstrating a deep understanding of the complex factors and influences at play.
The student fails to mention or demonstrate any understanding of the importance of Aeneas, Romulus and Remus, Cincinnatus, Julius Caesar, and Cicero.
The student mentions a few of the figures but demonstrates little to no understanding of their importance to the rise of the Roman Republic.
The student identifies several figures but provides superficial or inaccurate explanations of their importance.
The student accurately describes the importance of most of the figures to the rise of the Roman Republic, but the explanation lacks depth or insight.
The student clearly explains the importance of all the figures to the rise of the Roman Republic, demonstrating a solid understanding of their roles and contributions.
The student provides a nuanced and insightful analysis of the importance of each figure, demonstrating a deep understanding of their roles and contributions, and the interplay between them.
The student demonstrates no understanding of the historical context surrounding the rise of the Roman Republic and the figures mentioned.
The student shows a very limited awareness of the historical context, with significant gaps in knowledge.
The student demonstrates a basic understanding of the historical context but with significant omissions or misunderstandings.
The student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of the historical context, but lacks depth and detail.
The student demonstrates a strong understanding of the historical context, providing relevant details and explanations.
The student demonstrates a comprehensive and insightful understanding of the historical context, connecting events and figures to broader historical trends and influences.
